story:
The Tornado Shield is the world's first affordable, mobile, and puncture-resistant tornado protection for individuals and families.


Tornado Quick Facts

  • All 50 states are in danger of tornadoes

  • Over 1,275 tornadoes recorded annually since 1997

  • More than 90% of tornado victims suffer from lacerations

  • One Tornado Shield costs less than stitches at the emergency room

  • 99% of tornadoes are EF0 - EF3 (wind speed of 65-167mph)

  • Less than 1% are EF4-EF5 (wind speed of 168-234mph)

Campaign Facts

  • If the goal is not met by October 8th, 100% of all funds will be returned to contributers and no perks will be delivered.

How It All Began

The idea of Tuuli Armor was birthed out of the EF-5 tornado that hit Joplin, Missouri, on May 22, 2011. Like many others in our neighborhood, my family and I had no where to go, so we experienced the massive storm covered only by a mattress on our hallway floor.

The Huge Gap

In the days and months following the horrific storm, I began searching for a better way to protect my family but found the options were either too expensive or just unrealistic for our situation. As I thought about the many others in our town that weren't well-protected and the fact that the majority of tornado related injuries are lacerations, I knew I needed a small, affordable, and highly puncture-resistant design.

Months of research led me to ballistic nylon, which was invented by the military to protect soldiers from flying shrapnel. Using a pressurized air cannon, I conducted numerous tests (see more details below) with various fabrics and projectiles made of wood, metal, and glass. In one test, a metal projectile that penetrated three 1/2" pieces of plywood did not puncture the layers of ballistic nylon and padding now used in the Tornado Shield.

Implementing feedback from two product reviews with professionals from a wide range of disciplines refined it into the final product you see today.

Where To Use It:  Everywhere Safe Rooms Are Not

The Goal

The Tornado Shield campaign is using the fixed funding model because we actually need $105,000 to start production.  To purchase the custom red/orange ballistic nylon, the minimum order is 1,000 yards, which requires a significant investment of capital - and that's just one of the materials!

YOU have a part to play - whether it's giving $5 or $5,000 - to help make this layer of protection available.  Would you join the team and celebrate with us as this dream becomes a reality?

Perks


                   


Help Us Get The Word Out!

YOUR help is crucial!  Help get the word out to those who need protection from the next storm by sharing this campaign through your social media and email connections   We are offering $200 cash to the fan who brings in the most referral contributions!!

Here's how it works:  If you are logged into your Indiegogo account, just click one of the share options below the campaign video.  Every contribution from your share will be credited to you as a referral.

For those who don't have or want an Indiegogo account, simply purchase a perk of your choice and copy the special URL on the completed contribution landing page (under "Spread the Word"), and share it with your network.  Each contribution that comes in from that link will be credited to you as a referral.

During the campaign, we'll keep you updated on where you stand in the runnings.

Tornado Related Injuries

  • On average in the US, tornadoes cause 70 fatalities and 1,500 injuries each year (http://www.noaawatch.gov/themes/severe.php).
  • Soft-tissue wounds are among the most common tornado related injuries, and they are often contaminated with debris and bacteria and require irrigation and delayed closure (Bohonos, J. J., and D. E. Hogan, 1998: The medical impact of tornadoes in North America. J. Emerg. Med., 17, 67–73.; Brenner, S. A., and E. K. Noji, 1992: Wound infections after tornadoes. J. Trauma, 33, 673.  http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9950391).

  • Most of the injured have multiple wounds, many of which are in areas of exposed skin like the neck and head.  The skin exhibits a characteristic abrasion pattern due to fine particles of sand, mud, soil, and even water traveling at highly accelerated speeds (March, Gerard, 2002: Natural Disasters and the Impacts on Health, 5.  www.eird.org/isdr.../Natural%20disasters%20and%20the%20impacts.pdf).

Testing Method and Results

Method

Tests on the Tornado Shield were modeled after the National Institute of Justice's standard for testing bullet-proof vests. This test uses a clay back plate to simulate impact against the human body. A 3-inch deep clay block was made as the back plate for the testing. The fabric was laid over the clay to simulate the Tornado Shield laying over a person’s body. An air canon was used to shoot differing projectiles at the fabric at point blank range. The projectiles were shot perpendicular to the fabric and clay target, which were propped against a firm backing.

Speed

The standard test for a safe room includes shooting a 15-pound wooden 2x4 at 150 miles per hour.  Most Tornado Shield tests were performed with lighter objects but at speeds of 200-260 miles per hour.

Projectiles

The projectiles used in testing were made of glass, wood, and steel to simulate construction debris.  Each type of projectile was tested at different weights, but the highlights are listed here:

Wood:  A ¼-pound spike made from a 1.3 inch diameter wood rod sharpened to a point and launched at 200 miles per hour did not penetrate the Tornado Shield.

Metal Rod:  A 5-ounce, 3/8-inch round steel rod (simulating rebar) launched at 260 miles per hour did not penetrate the Tornado Shield but did penetrate a wooden 2x6 as well as 1.4 inches of plywood.

Glass Pieces:  A 3-ounce projectile with glass affixed to the tip (simulating a 25-square-inch sheet of glass) launched at 200 miles per hour caused a small prick in the Tornado Shield when struck at a perpendicular angle.

Glass Fragments:  Small glass fragments and safety glass did not penetrate the Tornado Shield when launched at 200 miles per hour.

Press and Publicity

  • Discovery Channel Daily Planet in Canada   Episode 131 September 11 – around minute 35. Click here.
  • Mail Online Travel News in the UK Click here.
  • Hong Kong Newspaper Click here for online version.
  • KOAM Channel 7 Click here.
  • KOLR Ozarks First Click here.
  • KZRG News/Talk Radio Click here.
  • Ozark's Live! News Click here.
  • St. Louis Post-Dispatch Click here.
  • Gizmag Click here.
  • Gizmodo Click here.
  • A Gentleman's Word Click here.
  • TrueSurvivalKit.com Guest Blogger Click here.
  • Dude I Want That Click here.

Comments

  • I think this bag is a beautiful idea. I think it's brilliant. I think it's well worth $400. Having been through this type of situation you're talking about, I can tell you I wish I had that. We are cut to shreds. We were injured very much because we had no protection against the flying debris and I'll tell you as soon as this goes on the market I will be buying one! (Silverspike  September 9, 2014 @ 12:47 pm PDT)
  • If you or a loved one lives in Tornado Alley, you MUST take a few minutes and watch this (Tornado Shield video). We cannot encourage young people to grow up, engineer, invent, and start businesses and then not put our financial shoulders behind them when they do. This product is amazing. I have held it in my hands. I will purchase one, maybe two. I think you should too. This project was born out of the tragedy of the Joplin Tornado of 2011. It is awesome to see such hope come out of such destruction. Get behind Tuuli Armor Tornado Protection, LLC and support them at https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/tuuli-armor-tornado-protection. People need this protection made available! (Neisha - September 9, 2014)
  • Guys! Seriously, this should be on the market. Coolers are cool and self tying water balloons are going to be bitchin' awesome next year, but these will save lives. Every little contribution helps. (Melodie - September 8, 2014)
  • Don't be so quick to underestimate the flying debris, granted heavier objects will crush you, and high speed projectiles will bruise you, but it should be simple to anchor the bag to the basement floor. (Maybe under a steel cage imbedded into sunken area). I think the idea has great merit, and at least offers protection from the maelstrom of shards of glass alone that would slice you to pieces. (Bob  September 9, 2014 @ 10:07 am PDT)
  • Do you have a plan in the event of a tornado? The inventor says it was never intended to replace safe rooms or basements, which are obviously better options in a storm, but not everyone has the money or space for something like that. If your only options are currently the bathtub or the closet, this would add some protection for a fraction of the price of a safe room. Three years after the Joplin tornado we have friends still suffering from debris wounds they got while hiding in the closet. (aja  September 11, 2014)

FAQs

    1.  Will it protect against blunt-force trauma?

    The Tornado Shield is not crush resistant and is NOT meant to replace hard-cover shelter like safe rooms or basements.  It was designed to provide an affordable layer of protection for those who don't have that option.  Most of the safety devices we use every day can't guarantee they'll save our lives (i.e. seat belts, helmets, life jackets), but we use them with the hope that they will help.  Did you know that more than 90% of those injured in tornadoes suffer lacerations from flying debris?  That being said, the Tornado Shield will help protect against the majority of tornado related injuries.

    2.  Can you breathe in it?

    Yes.  The bottom layer (black in the photos) is a non-coated rip-stop nylon that is very breathable. If pressed to the face one can breathe through it like breathing through a light t-shirt.

    3.  What about getting picked up by strong winds?

    The Tornado Shield was intentionally designed with no openings in order to keep the air lift to a minimum in high winds.  The flexible design also helps reduce the chances of going air born.

    4.  Why did you choose that material? 

    After several months of testing different materials, ballistic nylon clearly performed the best.  It was created by the military to protect soldiers against flying debris, so it makes sense!  For a more thorough explanation, see Testing Method and Results above.

    6.  How much does it weigh?

    13 pounds.

    7.  What are the dimensions, rolled up and open?

    Rolled up:  22"x9"
    Open: 60"x 85"

    8.  Where can I use it?

    Virtually anywhere!!  It can provide an added layer of protection at home in closets, hallways, bathtubs, or basements.  It's compact design also makes it easy to take it with you on the road whether in a car, truck, RV,  or semi.

    9.  What if I make a contribution and the campaign doesn't reach the goal?

    100% of your contribution will be refunded and no perks will be delivered.
story_txt:
The Tornado Shield is the world's first affordable, mobile, and puncture-resistant 
tornado protection for individuals and families.




Tornado Quick Facts

All 50 states are in danger of tornadoes
Over 1,275 tornadoes recorded annually since 1997
More than 90% of tornado victims suffer from
     lacerations
One Tornado Shield costs less than stitches at the
     emergency room
99% of tornadoes are EF0 - EF3 (wind speed of
     65-167mph)
Less than 1% are EF4-EF5 (wind speed of
     168-234mph)

Campaign Facts
If the goal is not met by October 8th, 100% of all funds will be returned to contributers and
     no perks will be delivered.
How It All Began

The idea of Tuuli Armor was birthed out of the EF-5 tornado that hit 
Joplin, Missouri, on May 22, 2011.  Like many others in our neighborhood, my family and I had no where to go, so we experienced the massive storm covered only by a mattress on our hallway floor.
The Huge Gap
In the days and months following the horrific storm, I began searching for a better way to protect my family but found the options were either too expensive or just unrealistic for our situation. As I thought about the many others in our town that weren't well-protected and the fact that the majority of tornado related injuries are lacerations, I knew I needed a small, affordable, and highly puncture-resistant design.
Months of research led me to ballistic nylon, which was invented by the 
military to protect soldiers
from flying shrapnel. Using a pressurized air cannon, I conducted 
numerous tests (see more details below) with various fabrics and projectiles made of wood, metal,
 and glass. In one test, a metal projectile that penetrated three 1/2" pieces of plywood did not puncture the layers of ballistic
 nylon and padding now used in the Tornado Shield.
Implementing feedback from two product reviews with professionals from a
 wide range of disciplines refined it into the final product you see 
today.

Where To Use It:  Everywhere Safe Rooms Are Not




The Goal
The Tornado Shield campaign is using the fixed funding model because we actually need $105,000 to start production.  To purchase the custom red/orange ballistic nylon, the minimum order is 1,000 yards, which requires a significant investment of capital - and that's just one of the materials!
YOU have a part to play - whether it's giving $5 or $5,000 - to help make this layer of protection available.  Would you join the team and celebrate with us as this dream becomes a reality? 
Perks
                    





Help Us Get The Word Out!

YOUR help is crucial!  Help get the word out to those who need protection from the next storm by sharing this campaign through your social media and email connections   We are offering $200 cash to the fan who brings in the most referral contributions!! 
Here's how it works:  If you are logged into your Indiegogo account, just click one of the share options below the campaign video.  Every contribution from your share will be credited to you as a referral.
For those who don't have or want an Indiegogo account, simply purchase a perk of your choice and copy the special URL on the completed contribution landing page (under "Spread the Word"), and share it with your network.  Each contribution that comes in from that link will be credited to you as a referral.
During the campaign, we'll keep you updated on where you stand in the runnings.
Tornado Related Injuries






On average in the US, tornadoes cause 70 fatalities and 1,500 injuries each year (http://www.noaawatch.gov/themes/severe.php).
Soft-tissue wounds are among the most common tornado related injuries, and they are often contaminated with debris and bacteria and require irrigation and delayed closure (Bohonos, J. J., and D. E. Hogan, 1998: The medical impact of tornadoes in North America. J. Emerg. Med., 17, 67–73.; Brenner, S. A., and E. K. Noji, 1992: Wound infections after tornadoes. J. Trauma, 33, 673.  http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9950391).

Most of the injured have multiple wounds, many of which are in areas of exposed skin like the neck and head.  The skin exhibits a characteristic abrasion pattern due to fine particles of sand, mud, soil, and even water traveling at highly accelerated speeds (March, Gerard, 2002: Natural Disasters and the Impacts on Health, 5.  www.eird.org/isdr.../Natural%20disasters%20and%20the%20impacts.pdf).

Testing Method and Results


MethodTests on the Tornado Shield were modeled after the National Institute of Justice's standard for testing bullet-proof vests. This test uses a clay back plate to simulate impact against the human body. A 3-inch deep clay block was made as the back plate for the testing. The fabric was laid over the clay to simulate the Tornado Shield laying over a person’s body. An air canon was used to shoot differing projectiles at the fabric at point blank range. The projectiles were shot perpendicular to the fabric and clay target, which were propped against a firm backing. SpeedThe standard test for a safe room includes shooting a 15-pound 
wooden 2x4 at 150 miles per hour.  Most Tornado Shield tests were performed with lighter objects but at speeds of 200-260 miles per hour.ProjectilesThe projectiles used in testing were made of glass, wood, and steel to simulate construction debris.  Each type of projectile was tested at different weights, but the highlights are listed here: Wood:  A ¼-pound spike made from a 1.3 inch diameter wood rod sharpened to a point and launched at 200 miles per hour did not penetrate the Tornado Shield.Metal Rod:  A 5-ounce, 3/8-inch round steel rod (simulating rebar) launched at 260 miles per hour did not penetrate the Tornado Shield but did penetrate a wooden 2x6 as well as 1.4 inches of plywood. Glass Pieces:  A 3-ounce projectile with glass affixed to the tip (simulating a 25-square-inch sheet of glass) launched at 200 miles per hour caused a small prick in the Tornado Shield when struck at a perpendicular angle. Glass Fragments:  Small glass fragments and safety glass did not penetrate the Tornado Shield when launched at 200 miles per hour. Press and Publicity


Discovery Channel Daily Planet in Canada   Episode 131 September 11 – around minute 35. Click here.

Mail Online Travel News in the UK Click here.

Hong
 Kong Newspaper Click here for online version.


KOAM Channel 7 Click here.

KOLR Ozarks First Click here.


KZRG News/Talk Radio Click here.


Ozark's Live! News Click here.

St.
  Louis Post-Dispatch Click here.

Gizmag Click here.

Gizmodo Click here.

A Gentleman's Word Click here.

TrueSurvivalKit.com Guest
Blogger Click here.

Dude I Want That Click here.

story:
As the owner of The EC Store since 2005, I've helped thousands of families practice elimination communication - also known as baby led potty training.  A small one piece potty is an indispensable tool in this process.  For several years now, a potty like this has been unavailable in the marketplace and I've been working on a way to bring one back, only better.
My design includes a few important features:
  • One piece, easy to empty and clean.
  • Clear plastic, so you know when they go.
  • Sized for babies, and also comfortable for toddlers.
  • Curved, ergonomic shape for a healthy squatting position.
  • Made in the USA!

Where will the money go?

The money raised here will cover the cost of tooling the molds needed to manufacture this potty design. I already have funds for the first run of clear potties to be made, once the molds are complete. I've chosen Fixed Funding because this will allow me to gauge interest in the Clear Potty. Years after the last Babywunder Deluxe potty sold, I still receive emails from people looking to buy a clear potty. Based on past sales, I know there's a market for potties like this.  You can help the Clear Potty become a reality by telling your friends about this campaign!

Clear Potties will go into production during December 2014 or January 2015 if the funding goal is met. If the goal of $6000 is not met, your money will be refunded to you and Clear Potties will not get made.  

Why now?

I have been researching plastic potty manufacturing for several years, since the clear potty I had been selling was discontinued.  Only recently did all the pieces come together in a way that I'm confident about both the process and the product.  By having the potties made with a vacuum-molding process, I'm keeping the tooling costs low (about 1/4 the cost of any other manufacturing process I've researched).  I'm also really excited about having the factory so close to home.  It's not just "Made in the USA" but practically in my backyard, meaning I can easily visit the factory and share progress with you as we go!


Foundation of Success

This isn't the first time I've done product development.  I have designed and produced several successful textile products for The EC Store, on various scales.  The SIMPLYcover is our trim, functional waterproof cloth diaper cover.  Size 1 Tiny Undies are the smallest underwear available anywhere, custom made to my specifications from organic Egyptian cotton.  Size 2 Undies were a quick follow-up in response to customer requests as their babies outgrew Size 1.  My business partner, Joy, helped develop and continues to tweak the patterns she uses to expertly sew our line of cloth training pants.

What is EC?

Elimination Communication is a complicated name for an amazingly simple and ancient technique of helping babies potty from birth.  It's a gentle, cooperative process between parent and baby that usually produces cleaner skin, fewer used diapers, and healthier pottying habits.
The Clear Potty isn't only for babies.  The size is also suitable for toddlers using a potty around two or three years of age.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute right now, that doesn't mean you can't help!  Please share this Clear Potty campaign with interested friends and contacts!

story:
MoreSun™ is the world's first and only solar coating that can be applied in the field to operational solar panels, increasing efficiency by reducing reflection losses.

  

Generate Solar Power

Currently there are 320 million installed solar panels world-wide that need to be upgraded to increase panel efficiency and reduce reflection losses. Upgrading all of them with MoreSun coating will generate 3.2 gigawatts of new solar power.

We have demonstrated the performance of our MoreSun coating -- for ease of application, efficiency, and robustness -- on our pilot arrays in Corvallis, Oregon.  Of the four panels shown below, you can tell which is the uncoated panel (for testing comparison) because it reflects the blue sky -- lost photons!  The three panels with our MoreSun coating appear darker as they more efficiently soak up the energy of the sun.



The graph below shows MoreSun coating's performance data over 25 days of cloudy and sunny Oregon weather. During this time, our MoreSun coating survived rain, frost, hail, and wind.  The 4% average increase represents about ten watts per panel. Ten watts per panel multiplied by the 320,000,000 uncoated panels world-wide generates 3.2 gigawatts of new solar power. (Note: ARC refers to Anti-Reflective Coating, the technical term for MoreSun coating).


Enhancement of Solar Panels with MoreSun Coating

Daily Energy Gain (%) in Various Weather Conditions


Displace CO2

The 3.2 gigawatts of new solar power generated by MoreSun coating will displace the production of 72 million tons of CO2 from fossil fuel power plants over the next 20 years or 3.6 million tons/yr.


Save Birds

In addition to reduced efficiency, uncoated panels also pose a threat to birds.  The reflected sunlight off the uncoated panels can confuse birds by looking like a body of water.  When the birds try and land on the panels, they can be injured or stranded, then die. Tragically, such waterfowl as Grebes, Cormorants, and Coots, have fallen victim at large solar facilities in the United States (Avian Mortality at Solar Facilities).


Birds mistake the uncoated panels for water because the light the panels reflect is polarized (See Polarized Light Pollution below). Water naturally polarizes light and if you have ever been to the lake or ocean on a sunny day, you have seen this phenomenon.  Polarized light is the glare that causes you to reach for your sunglasses.

 

Many birds, insects, and other animals use polarized light to identify water, as well as, for general navigation.  MoreSun coating has been documented to reduce the amount of reflected polarized light from panels to the amount naturally reflected by the ground.  This will allow birds to fly over solar arrays without confusion.

Once we demonstrate that anti-reflective coatings mitigate bird losses at solar arrays, the US Fish and Wildlife Service may require all solar arrays to have anti-reflective coatings under the Migratory Bird Treaty Act (MBTA). The European Union has a similar protection act, the Birds Directive, which may require similar mandates. Requiring anti-reflective coatings on all solar panel arrays has the potential to save birds on an international scale.


We Need YOUR Help...

Beta Sites

MoreSun coating is a breakthrough technology and array owners need to see the performance at a larger scale and under the conditions of their arrays. We need  $50,000 to coat a minimum of five beta demonstration sites world-wide in order to demonstrate the performance of our MoreSun coating in a range of climates, configurations, and types of panels.

Climates range from Hamburg, Germany to Phoenix, Arizona. Configurations range from single to triple stacked, portrait and landscape, and ground mount to roof top. Panel types range from crystalline silicon to thin film (CIGS/CdTe).

We expect beta testing to take 12-18 months, once we are funded.

Early Adopters

We also need Early Adopters who would like to contribute to the implementation of MoreSun coating by having their own solar arrays, residential or commercial, upgraded.

Your Impact!

We are asking those of you who don't have your own solar array to make a contribution toward coating panels at our beta test sites.

Be sure to advise your friends who do have solar arrays to be an Early Adopter

Short Term Impact of Contributions

In the short term your contribution will generate solar power and displace CO2.          

Solar Power Generated and CO2 Displaced by Your Beta Site Contributions
  • $25 → 550 lbs (250 kg) of CO2 displaced
  • $50 → 1100 lbs (500 kg) of CO2 displaced
  • $100 → 50 solar watts and 1 ton of CO2 displaced
  • $500 → 250 solar watts and 5 ton of CO2 displaced
  • $1,000 → 500 solar watts and 10 ton of CO2 displaced
Solar Power Generated and CO2 Displaced by Coating Your Array

  • $400 → 200 solar watts and 4 tons of CO2 displaced
  • $4,000 → 2,000 solar watts and 40 tons of CO2 displaced.

Long Term Impact of Contributions

In the long term your contribution will help us to implement MoreSun coatings world-wide and generate up to 3.2 gigawatts of new solar power, displace 72 million tons of CO2, and save untold numbers of birds.

Perk Examples

Note:  We will ship all U.S. domestic items free of charge.  If you are outside the United States, please add the "International Shipping" perk.

MoreSun Bumper Stickers!! ($25)


MoreSun Tote Bag!! ($50)


MoreSun T-Shirt!! ($100)

Front:

Back (4 options):



Be an Early Adopter - Coat Your Array

If you have an array at your residence, we are planning to set up distributors (contact us if you are interested) around the US over the next two years. The results from this Indiegogo campaign will help determine where we go first. Cost is $400 for the first 20 (or less) panels (about 200 new watts) plus $75 for each additional 5 panel increment.

Caveats:
1) Array must be safely accessible
2) Array must be owned by you or you must have permission from the owner (Solar City, etc)
3) Array must not have a functioning factory-applied coating (high efficiency SolarWorld and SunPower panels typically have a factory-applied coating)
4) Array must be in USA (timing depends on location and size)

If we are unable to coat your residential array for any reason, we will refund your donation.

If you have a commercial or utility scale array that you would like us to upgrade, the minimum size is 200 panels for $4,000, about 2,000 new watts. More than 200 panels is $300 for each 20 panel increment. Timing depends on size and location - sooner if you are located in Oregon, Washington, or Northern California.

 

 

Caveats:
1) Array must be safely accessible
2) Array must be owned by you or you must have permission from the owner (Solar City, etc)
3) Array must not have a functioning factory-applied coating (high efficiency SolarWorld and SunPower panels typically have a factory-applied coating)

4) Array must be in the USA. If there is enough interest outside the USA, we will setup an International Perk

If we are unable to coat your commercial array for any reason, we will refund your donation.

Special Warren Buffet 15MW Utility Upgrade
For a very special price of $0.80 per watt, we will coat the Topaz Solar Farm with MoreSun coating. That's $12 million for 20 MW of additional solar power.
Win: Payback - less than 3 years.
Win: Displace 14,000 more tons of CO2 annually,
Win: Reduce polarized light pollution and save birds

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, please help to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

"As all the world is cheered by the sun,"  Richard III

"O, 'tis the sun that maketh all things shine."  Love's Labour's Lost

Polarized Light Pollution

Many waterbird species use polarized light to locate bodies of water (see Horvath et al., 2009). The polarized light produced by solar panels may be confused for naturally polarized light, and is thought to look like a body of water to migrating birds. This confusion, especially at large scale solar sites, could attract migrating birds resulting in lost migration time, injury, stranding, and death.  Government agencies are monitoring solar array sites intensively to gather hard data on the full ecological impact of polarized light on birds (see Avian Mortality at Solar Energy Facilities).

It has also been documented that polarized light pollution can affect the ability for a variety of insects, reptiles, and fish to detect natural polarized light patterns in the sky. This can effect their navigation ability and ultimately effects on dispersal and reproduction (see Greif et al., 2014 and MSU Today).  Furthermore, polarized light pollution can create unfavorable environments that result in mutualistic species necessary for native plant life cycles, such as seed dispersers and pollinators, to be extirpated from an affected area. Many animals including potential pollinators such as bees, desert ants, and beetles also utilize polarized light patters for orientation and navigation. Therefore, polarized light produced by solar panels may be confused for natural polarized light and attract or confuse dispersing and migrating individuals, and may reduce successful plant reproduction on the proposed project site by confusing and disorienting pollinators (see Panoche Valley Solar Farm Report).

Risks & Challenges

The technical challenge is scaling up our application process to coat hundreds of panels per day. Our target rate for utility scale arrays is 40 panels per hour. Our team members have extensive experience in scaling up chemical and mechanical processes.

The biggest market/business risks are indifference and unawareness. With your support, this Indiegogo campaign can help raise awareness of the availability and benefits of MoreSun coating.


The Technology- For those who want to know

MoreSun coating is a silica-based sol-gel in alcohol. It is applied as a uniform ~10 micron fluid film with a MoreSun applicator. The applicator controls the fluid deposition using capillary fluid mechanics. The resulting nanostructured 150 nm coating functions on Gradient Index of Refraction (GRIN) principles with feature sizes less than 20 nm. MoreSun coating has been subjected to accelerated abrasion and humidity testing. It's projected lifetime in the field is 20+ years.  


MoreSun's Beginnings...

 

MoreSun coating is built on anti-reflection technology that was conceived at Oregon State University and funded by grants from the National Science Fountation, Oregon Nanoscience and Microtechnologies Institute, and Oregon BEST. About 9 months ago, the MoreSun Team and their advisers at Oregon State University saw an opportunity to apply this innovative technology to installed solar panels.  The technology is ready for scale-up. We need your support to help make it happen.


The MoreSun Team

Paul Ahrens (62) BS/MS MIT Chemical Engineering, successful entrepreneur
Dr. Seung-yeol Han (38) PhD OSU Chemical Engineering, inventor of the MoreSun coating
Adam Gage (23) BS OSU Chemical Engineering, inventor of the MoreSun applicator

Dr Han and Paul Ahrens have been working together on AR coatings for 2 1/2 years. Adam joined the team a year ago.

Advisers:
Prof. Chih-hung Chang, Chemical Engineering, OSU
Prof. Brian Paul,  Manufacturing Engineering, OSU
Prof. Jimmy Yang, Finance, OSU
John de Vos, Mechanical Engineering, MBA, PMP, PE
story_txt:
MoreSun™ is the world's first and only solar coating that
can be applied in the field to operational solar panels, increasing efficiency by reducing reflection losses. 
  
Generate Solar Power
Currently there are 320 million installed solar panels world-wide that need to be upgraded
to increase panel efficiency and reduce reflection losses. Upgrading all of them with MoreSun coating will generate 3.2 gigawatts of new solar power.We have demonstrated the 
performance of our MoreSun coating -- for ease of application, 
efficiency, and robustness -- on our pilot arrays in Corvallis, Oregon. 
 Of the four panels shown below, you can tell which is the uncoated 
panel (for testing comparison) because
it reflects the blue sky -- lost photons! 
The three panels with our MoreSun coating appear darker as they more efficiently soak up the energy of the sun.


The graph below shows MoreSun coating's performance data over 25 days
 of cloudy and sunny Oregon weather. During this time, our MoreSun 
coating survived rain, frost, hail, and wind.  The 4% average increase 
represents about ten watts per panel. Ten watts per panel multiplied by 
the 320,000,000 uncoated panels world-wide generates 3.2 gigawatts of 
new solar power. (Note: ARC refers to Anti-Reflective Coating, the 
technical term for MoreSun coating). 



Enhancement of Solar Panels with MoreSun Coating



Daily Energy Gain (%) in Various Weather Conditions



Displace CO2
The 3.2 gigawatts of new solar power generated by MoreSun coating will displace the production of 72 million tons of CO2 from fossil fuel power plants over the next 20 years or 3.6 million tons/yr.



Save Birds

In addition to reduced efficiency, uncoated panels also pose a
threat to birds.  The reflected sunlight
off the uncoated panels can confuse birds by looking like a body of water.  When the birds try and land on the panels, they can be injured or stranded, then die. Tragically, such waterfowl as Grebes,
Cormorants, and Coots, have fallen victim at large solar
facilities in the United States (Avian Mortality at Solar Facilities).

Birds mistake the uncoated panels for water because the
light the panels reflect is polarized (See Polarized Light Pollution below).
Water naturally polarizes light and if you have ever been to the lake or
ocean on a sunny day, you have seen this phenomenon.  Polarized light is the glare that causes you
to reach for your sunglasses.
 
Many birds, insects, and other animals use polarized light to identify water, as well as, for
general navigation.  MoreSun
coating has been documented to reduce the amount of reflected polarized light from panels to the amount naturally reflected by the ground.  This will allow birds to fly over solar arrays without confusion.

Once we demonstrate that anti-reflective coatings mitigate bird losses at solar arrays, the US Fish and Wildlife Service may require all solar arrays to have anti-reflective coatings under the Migratory Bird Treaty Act (MBTA). The European Union has a similar protection act, the Birds Directive, which may require similar mandates. Requiring anti-reflective coatings on all solar panel arrays has the potential to save birds on an international scale.


We Need YOUR Help...
Beta Sites 
MoreSun coating is a breakthrough technology and array owners need to see the performance at a larger scale and under the conditions of their arrays. We need  $50,000 to coat a minimum of five beta demonstration sites world-wide in order to demonstrate the performance of our MoreSun coating in a range of climates, configurations, and types of panels. 
Climates range from Hamburg, Germany to Phoenix, Arizona. Configurations range from single to triple stacked, portrait and landscape, and ground mount to roof top. Panel types range from crystalline silicon to thin film (CIGS/CdTe). We
 expect beta testing to take 12-18 months, once we are funded.


Early Adopters 
We also need Early Adopters who would like to contribute to the implementation of MoreSun coating by having their own solar arrays, residential or commercial, upgraded.  
Your Impact!
We are asking those of you who don't have your own solar 
array to make a contribution toward coating panels 
at our beta test sites. 
Be sure to advise your friends who do have solar arrays to be an Early Adopter
Short Term Impact of Contributions 
In the short term your contribution will generate solar power and displace CO2.           

Solar Power Generated and CO2
Displaced by Your Beta Site Contributions

$25 → 550 lbs (250 kg) of CO2 displaced
$50 → 1100 lbs (500 kg) of CO2 displaced
$100 → 50 solar watts and 1 ton of CO2 displaced
$500 → 250 solar watts and 5 ton of CO2 displaced
$1,000 → 500 solar watts and 10 ton of CO2 displaced

Solar Power Generated and CO2
Displaced by Coating Your Array

$400 → 200 solar watts and 4 tons of CO2 displaced
$4,000 → 2,000 solar watts and 40 tons of CO2 displaced.


Long Term Impact of Contributions In the long term your contribution will help us to implement MoreSun coatings world-wide and generate up to 3.2 gigawatts of new solar power, displace 72 million tons of CO2, and save untold numbers of birds.
Perk Examples Note:  We
will ship all U.S. domestic items free of charge.  If you are outside the United States, please add the "International Shipping" perk.
MoreSun Bumper Stickers!! ($25) 


MoreSun Tote Bag!! ($50)



MoreSun T-Shirt!! ($100)Front:
Back (4 options):Be an Early Adopter - Coat Your Array If you have an array at your residence, we are planning to set up
distributors (contact us if you are interested) around the US over the next two years.
The results from this Indiegogo campaign will help determine where we go first.
Cost is $400 for the first 20 (or less) panels (about 200 new watts) plus $75
for each additional 5 panel increment. 

Caveats:
1) Array must be safely accessible 
2) Array must be owned by you or you must have permission from the owner (Solar
City, etc)
3) Array must not have a functioning factory-applied coating (high efficiency
SolarWorld and SunPower panels typically have a factory-applied coating)
4) Array must be in USA (timing depends on location and size)

If we are unable to coat your residential array for any
reason, we will refund your donation.


If you have a commercial or utility scale array that you would like us to upgrade, the minimum size is 200 panels for $4,000, about 2,000 new
watts. More than 200 panels is $300 for each 20 panel increment. Timing depends
on size and location - sooner if you are located in Oregon, Washington, or
Northern California.  Caveats:
1) Array must be safely accessible 
2) Array must be owned by you or you must have permission from the owner (Solar
City, etc)
3) Array must not have a functioning factory-applied coating (high efficiency
SolarWorld and SunPower panels typically have a factory-applied coating)
4) Array must be in the USA. If there is enough interest
outside the USA, we will setup an International Perk
If we are unable to coat your commercial array for any
reason, we will refund your donation.
Special Warren Buffet 15MW Utility Upgrade
For a very special price of $0.80 per watt, we will coat the Topaz Solar Farm
with MoreSun coating. That's $12 million for 20 MW of additional solar power. 
Win: Payback - less than 3 years. 
Win: Displace 14,000 more tons of CO2 annually, 
Win: Reduce polarized light pollution and save birds
 
Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute 
monetarily, please help to get the word out and make some noise about 
our campaign. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
 "As all the world is cheered by the sun,"  Richard III
"O, 'tis the sun that maketh all things shine."  Love's Labour's Lost
Polarized Light Pollution Many waterbird species use polarized light to locate bodies of water (see Horvath et al., 2009).  The
polarized light produced by solar panels may be confused for naturally polarized
light, and is thought to look like a body of water to migrating birds. This confusion, especially at large scale
solar sites, could attract migrating birds resulting in lost migration time,
injury, stranding, and death.  Government
agencies are monitoring solar array sites intensively to gather hard data on the
full ecological impact of polarized light on birds (see Avian Mortality at Solar Energy Facilities).

 It
has also been documented that polarized light pollution can affect the ability
for a variety of insects, reptiles, and fish to detect natural polarized light
patterns in the sky. This can effect their navigation ability and
ultimately effects on dispersal and reproduction (see Greif et al., 2014 and MSU Today).  Furthermore, polarized light pollution can create unfavorable environments that result in mutualistic species necessary for native plant life cycles, such as seed dispersers and pollinators, to be extirpated from an affected area. Many animals including potential pollinators such as bees, desert ants, and beetles also utilize polarized light patters for orientation and navigation. Therefore, polarized light produced by solar panels may be confused for natural polarized light and attract or confuse dispersing and migrating individuals, and may reduce successful plant reproduction on the proposed project site by confusing and disorienting pollinators (see Panoche Valley Solar Farm Report).

Risks & Challenges The technical challenge is scaling up our application process to coat hundreds of panels per day. Our target rate for utility scale arrays is 40 panels per
 hour. Our team members have extensive 
experience in scaling up chemical and mechanical processes.

 The biggest market/business risks are indifference and unawareness. 
With your support, this Indiegogo campaign can help raise awareness of the 
availability and benefits of MoreSun coating.



The Technology- For those who want to know
MoreSun coating is a silica-based sol-gel in alcohol. It is applied
 as a uniform ~10 micron fluid film with a MoreSun applicator. The 
applicator controls the fluid deposition using capillary fluid 
mechanics. The resulting nanostructured 150 nm coating functions on 
Gradient Index of Refraction (GRIN) principles with feature sizes less 
than 20 nm. MoreSun coating has been subjected to accelerated abrasion 
and humidity testing. It's projected lifetime in the field is 20+ years.  


MoreSun's Beginnings...

 
MoreSun coating is built on anti-reflection technology
that was conceived at Oregon State University and funded by grants from the
National Science Fountation, Oregon Nanoscience and Microtechnologies
Institute, and Oregon BEST. About 9 months ago, the MoreSun Team and their
advisers at Oregon State University saw an opportunity to apply this innovative technology to installed solar panels.  The technology is ready for scale-up. We need your
support to help make it happen.


The MoreSun Team
Paul Ahrens (62) BS/MS MIT Chemical Engineering, successful entrepreneurDr. Seung-yeol Han (38) PhD OSU Chemical Engineering, inventor of the MoreSun coatingAdam Gage (23) BS OSU Chemical Engineering, inventor of the MoreSun applicatorDr Han and Paul Ahrens have been working together on AR coatings for 2 1/2 years. Adam joined the team a year ago. Advisers:Prof. Chih-hung Chang, Chemical Engineering, OSUProf. Brian Paul,  Manufacturing Engineering, OSUProf. Jimmy Yang, Finance, OSUJohn de Vos, Mechanical Engineering, MBA, PMP, PE

story:
ALVOTA Cologne Bracelet is a One-In-All design allowing you to smell fresh anywhere and anytime without bringing a cologne or personal kit with you.   
 

  

ALVOTA Cologne Bracelet gives you the power to present yourself fully in a conversation without worrying the odor.

 

Have you ever carried a cologne atomizer or a cologne roller with you but it spilled out in your bags? Or you just don’t want to carry heavy while going out?
 


After surveying over 1000 males about businessmen's concerns, the most brought up keywords are “Good Smelling, Look Stylish, Easy To Carry”.

So we came up with this idea:  " A Portable Cologne That Looks Stylish."
 

Studies have shown that when it comes to decision making, indoor air and odor may matter more than we have realized.

You can leave a perfect impression on wearing an ALVOTA infused with your cologne and applying it before any of these circumstances.
 


 

For Businesses 

As a frequent business traveler, if you need to be in a meeting right after you land, you need an ALVOTA Bracelet to leave a perfect impression. 
 

 

For Datings or Social events

You can attract your date or a group with an always-smell-fresh ALVOTA. They may not even notice when you apply your cologne. 
 


 

For Sports 

If you are a runner or sports activist and want to carry light with all your kits, portable cologne wear is the perfect solution to doing sport with style and staying fresh. 
 

The team has spent over one year to create the largest capacity, the best sealing function and tested out the most suitable combination of materials for the state of the art portable titanium cologne bracelet. 
 


We decided to use medical-grade titanium because it is more superior and expensive than most of the stainless steel and silver products.

Moreover, it is light in weight, anti-corrosive, strong heat resistant, bio-compatible and anti-allergic. 
 


As for the special container design, the above three unique designs give ALVOTA the ultimate sealing capability and easy-to-apply function. 

There are 8 more features that make ALVOTA Titanium Bracelet so special. Check it out!
 

Here is a demonstration of how an ALVOTA bracelet compares with other related products, such as a cologne bottle, a fragrance spray, or a single function accessory. 
 


Here are the three most commonly asked products in comparison with the top 9 ALVOTA functionalities.
 

ALVOTA v.s. Cologne Bottle

ALVOTA v.s. Cuff Bracelet

ALVOTA v.s. Cologne Atomizer

ALVOTA Cologne bracelet gives men the luxury of applying cologne anywhere and anytime you want. It is easy to refill cologne in the ALVOTA container with a simple open/refill design. 

  • How to apply: Rotate > Pull > Pour 
  • How to refill: Rotate > Unplug > Spray-in 

<<The only difference: You need to unplug the plastic cover to refill with cologne. >>
 

Simply spray in two or three kinds of colognes you like in the container to blend in and create your own signature cologne scent!

Here is a guide that gives you some hint to create your own unique scent and indulge your creativity in scent without ever making mistakes.

Apart from cologne or perfume, you can also add whatever liquid you want in the ALVOTA Titanium container, like alcohol or mosquito repellent.
 

**NOTE: If you want to change the liquid inside the container, just simply wash the container with soapy water, rinse with water and dry it with a cotton swab to dry the container. Very simple!

    As we want every bracelet to perfectly match your wrist size, please follow the below steps to measure your wrist size. When measuring your wrist, please measure:

    1. Please measure at the point just between your hand and the wrist bone.
    2. Please measure in a tighter fit.
    3. Please do not add any 'space' yourself to your wrist measurement.
       


    Don't have a measuring tape? 

    1. Use a piece of string or paper to measure at the point between your hand and the wrist bone and in a tighter fit.

    2. Lay the string or paper back out on a ruler to get your measurement in inches or centimeters.

    Please refer to the below illustration for your easy understanding.

    We provide the following bracelet sizes for different wrist sizes.

    • XS: 15-16cm / 5.7-6.1 inches 
    • S:    16-17cm / 6.2-6.4 inches 
    • M:   17-18cm / 6.5-7.0 inches 
    • L:    18-19.9cm / 7.1-7.9inches 
    • XL: 20cm or above / 8 inches or above


    You might have issues picking from M or L. If you are still not sure after measurement, we would recommend picking a tighter fit.

    • The average wrist size for men would be a M for 17.78 cm / 7 inches wrist.
    • ​The average wrist size for women would be a S for 16.50 cm / 6.5 inches wrist.  

     

     

    After sourcing and testing the durability of the gemstones and how they can best demonstrate ALVOTA's value, we humbly present to you "THE FIVE ELEMENTS".
     

    Metal - Brown (Tiger Eye) : Assertion 


     

    Wood - Black (Obsidian) : Creative 


     

    Water - Blue (Lapis Lazuli) : Calmness 


     

    Fire - Orange (Jasper) : Passion 


     

    Earth - Green (Turquoise) : Discipline 

     

    [ UNLOCK ] Achieved Over 300% Goal- White Howlite：Purity

    Five Elements Theory is a Chinese philosophy. The interaction with the five elements generates yin and yang, creating Feng Shui under the balance. 

    Five elements are associated with body organs. Each organ is related to the season of the year and specific emotions.

    You can impress people by smelling good anywhere & anytime and better your health system at the same time.
     


    The Five Elements is also the fundamental of the Chi energy system. The development of mental and spiritual Chi under each element will active all human functions. 

    Intaking the food of the right element strengthens the circulation of Chi, providing the individual with more energy to formalize and develop your Chi system.
     

    ALVOTA has combined the star signs with the Five Elements Theory. It is said a master of such can find balance, bring luck and create success.

story:
Following a successful initial funding, we're stoked to offer additional perks through Indiegogo.  Our initial run is in production, and we've made room for further contributions.

If you ride, and you've been blessed (cursed?) with a sense of style, you know how hard it is to find a decent pair of shoes. Something more protective than Chucks, and less clunky than full-on boots. Something you can wear throughout the day and not look like a cast member from Mad Max. Actually, Mad Max is pretty awesome, but you know what I mean. Anyway, problem solved. Meet the IR x RM Outback. Built to ride.

We're not so naive as to believe that we're inventing a category here, but we do think we're jumping pretty far out in front of a category that's sorely lacking in style. But rest assured, we're not stopping at making shoes that look cool. No, we’ve endeavored to create a very special pair of shoes with some real riding functionality built in. Let me tell you what we’ve done:

 

We started by sourcing genuine Horween, full-grain leather from their tannery in Chicago. This is seriously beautiful leather. We’re using 2.5mm thick pieces for the main upper panels. Then we modified our standard toe cap by extending it to offer shifter protection. We even did the same on the right foot for you vintage British bike riders! Speaking of vintage bike riders, if you ride a kickstart bike you’ll be pleased to hear that we’ve stiffened our standard Vari-flex Bi Fit composite lasting board by about 25% from the heel to the mid foot to give you more protection from deflection when kicking over your bike 100 times. We retained our normal flex characteristic in the front so you can walk like regular human, assuming you’re a regular human. The collar is a super soft but durable oiled suede, and hidden in the collar, both medially and laterally, is a nylon malleolus (ankle bone) protector.  

We know buying gear online can be hard, especially riding gear. So, in an effort to help you determine whether or not these shoots (shoes/boots? No?) fit into your carefully curated bike life, we've created this informative graphic. I'd wish you good luck, but there's no luck needed here, this is science.

 Still unsure? Are you thinking, "sure they look great, but will I be able to wear them for my preferred motorcycling activities? Good question. Let's take a look at this usage chart and maybe we can determine if they're right for you.

All set? Now all you have to decide is whether it will be Black or Brown? Or both! 

We all know that the tie that binds brands in collaborations can often be tenuous, if not pure marketing hype. So, let me assure you right off the top, that’s not the case here. Sort of. Our story goes all the way back to eighteen months ago, when I sat down with Iron and Resin founder, Thom Hill, to pitch him this idea. Of course I was already a fan of his brand, and since we’re both Souther California companies with shared interests, we have many mutual friends. However, we didn’t know each other. Nevertheless, I invaded his beautiful little Airstream trailer and told him my idea. I showed Thom a sketch and laid out my thoughts on how I’d like to turn an ordinary Ridgemont Outback sneaker boot into a proper motorcycle riding sneaker boot, and how I thought using Iron and Resin as inspiration for materials and colors was a match made in heaven. I sat there, droning on about shift protector overlays and internal malleolus protectors, until his eyes sort of glazed over and he raised his hand in the universal sign for “shut the fuck up.” I thought it was over. I began lining up more points in my mind about our shared perspectives and love of the outdoors, but the light returned to his gaze and he lowered his hand and said, “you had me at motorcycle.” 

And there it is my friends. BECAUSE MOTORCYCLE. When you love bikes as much as we do, what more reason do you need?

HAND MADE COTTON T-SHIRT
Available in the only color you need. Black.

 

BOTTLE OPENING KEYCHAIN CARABINER
Available in the only two colors you need. Brown or Black.

 

These dates are estimates based on our experience and may change. However, we'll keep you informed along the way so you'll know the status of your order. 

You've surely noticed that big gap in the timeline between ordering materials and them being delivered, and you may be wondering what that's about. Well, we decided that some things are worth the wait, and genuine Horween™ leather from Chicago is one of those things. Our leather will be made for our production so I'm afraid there's really no way to shorten that timeline. We're confident, however, that once you have them in your hand and you feel that buttery leather, you'll be glad you waited.

FOLLOW AND SUBSCRIBE TO STAY UP TO DATE WITH THIS CAMPAIGN AND OTHER COOL EVENTS AND PROMOTIONS.

INSTAGRAM | FACEBOOK | NEWSLETTER | WEBSITE

INSTAGRAM | FACEBOOK | NEWSLETTER | WEBSITE

 

Risks and challenges

Ridgemont is a fully-operational footwear brand. Although this is a special project, it’s not outside the realm of what we do everyday.

As we’re not factory owners, there’s always the risk of a factory closure or an inability to produce at our primary facility, due to capacity issues. In the unlikely event of such an occurrence, Ridgemont will move production to another facility that we’ve already vetted. We could also face issues with our current material suppliers, but again, we have alternative suppliers should the need arise.

 

FAQs

Q:  How will you know what size(s) to send me?

A:  

Once funding closes, we’ll send out a survey to get your sizing information.

Q:  How do your shoes fit?

A:  Our shoes run pretty true to size, with an athletic fit. If you wear a 9 in Nike, you’ll most likely wear a 9 in Ridgemont. If you have a wide foot, you may want to go choose a half size larger.

Q:  What about women's sizes?

A:  To determine your US men's size, subtract 1.5 from the women's.  For example, a men's 8 is the equivalent of a women's 9.5.

Q:  Would these shoes be considered protective riding gear?

A:  In short, no.  We know a lot of riders, ourselves included, ride in casual shoes often because riding boots are bulky, cumbersome, and look weird in everyday situations. We’re offering something more protective than casual shoes, but less protective than full-on riding boot. If you’re looking for maximum protection, look elsewhere.

The collar is a super soft but durable oiled suede, and hidden in the collar, both medially and laterally, is a nylon malleolus (ankle bone) protector.  We know buying gear online can be hard, especially riding gear. So, in an effort to help you determine whether or not these shoots (shoes/boots? No?) fit into your carefully curated bike life, we've created this informative graphic. I'd wish you good luck, but there's no luck needed here, this is science. Still unsure? Are you thinking, "sure they look great, but will I be able to wear them for my preferred motorcycling activities? Good question. Let's take a look at this usage chart and maybe we can determine if they're right for you.All set? Now all you have to decide is whether it will be Black or Brown? Or both! We all know that the tie that binds brands in collaborations can often be tenuous, if not pure marketing hype. So, let me assure you right off the top, that’s not the case here. Sort of. Our story goes all the way back to eighteen months ago, when I sat down with Iron and Resin founder, Thom Hill, to pitch him this idea. Of course I was already a fan of his brand, and since we’re both Souther California companies with shared interests, we have many mutual friends. However, we didn’t know each other. Nevertheless, I invaded his beautiful little Airstream trailer and told him my idea. I showed Thom a sketch and laid out my thoughts on how I’d like to turn an ordinary Ridgemont Outback sneaker boot into a proper motorcycle riding sneaker boot, and how I thought using Iron and Resin as inspiration for materials and colors was a match made in heaven. I sat there, droning on about shift protector overlays and internal malleolus protectors, until his eyes sort of glazed over and he raised his hand in the universal sign for “shut the fuck up.” I thought it was over. I began lining up more points in my mind about our shared perspectives and love of the outdoors, but the light returned to his gaze and he lowered his hand and said, “you had me at motorcycle.” And there it is my friends. BECAUSE MOTORCYCLE. When you love bikes as much as we do, what more reason do you need?HAND MADE COTTON T-SHIRTAvailable in the only color you need. Black. BOTTLE OPENING KEYCHAIN CARABINERAvailable in the only two colors you need. Brown or Black. These dates are estimates based on our experience and may change. However, we'll keep you informed along the way so you'll know the status of your order. You've surely noticed that big gap in the timeline between ordering materials and them being delivered, and you may be wondering what that's about. Well, we decided that some things are worth the wait, and genuine Horween™ leather from Chicago is one of those things. Our leather will be made for our production so I'm afraid there's really no way to shorten that timeline. We're confident, however, that once you have them in your hand and you feel that buttery leather, you'll be glad you waited.FOLLOW AND SUBSCRIBE TO STAY UP TO DATE WITH THIS CAMPAIGN AND OTHER COOL EVENTS AND PROMOTIONS.INSTAGRAM | FACEBOOK | NEWSLETTER | WEBSITEINSTAGRAM | FACEBOOK | NEWSLETTER | WEBSITE Risks and challengesRidgemont is a fully-operational footwear brand. Although this is a special project, it’s not outside the realm of what we do everyday.As we’re not factory owners, there’s always the risk of a factory closure or an inability to produce at our primary facility, due to capacity issues. In the unlikely event of such an occurrence, Ridgemont will move production to another facility that we’ve already vetted. We could also face issues with our current material suppliers, but again, we have alternative suppliers should the need arise. FAQsQ:  How will you know what size(s) to send me?A:  Once funding closes, we’ll send out a survey to get your sizing information.Q:  How do your shoes fit?A:  Our shoes run pretty true to size, with an athletic fit. If you wear a 9 in Nike, you’ll most likely wear a 9 in Ridgemont. If you have a wide foot, you may want to go choose a half size larger.Q:  What about women's sizes?A:  To determine your US men's size, subtract 1.5 from the women's.  For example, a men's 8 is the equivalent of a women's 9.5.Q:  Would these shoes be considered protective riding gear?A:  In short, no.  We know a lot of riders, ourselves included, ride in casual shoes often because riding boots are bulky, cumbersome, and look weird in everyday situations. We’re offering something more protective than casual shoes, but less protective than full-on riding boot. If you’re looking for maximum protection, look elsewhere.

story:
SCUBAMARE (KRAUSWATCHES)

My name is Thomas Kraus. I come from the metropolitan region of Nuremberg and have been fascinated by wristwatches since my childhood.

  • I want to make life more pleasant with my watches.
  • My great ideas waiting to become reality so that many can enjoy it.
  • Be a part of the first "SCUBAMARE" and support it today

Our campaign goal

20.000 $ (Prototypes, first series, early bird benefits)

  • If you spent 250$ or more you get 1 watch for free (regular price will be 380$)
  • The first series will have a limited feature
  • Take this unique opportunity

The limited early bird edtion 

You are more than a supporter. If you spent 250$ or more you get one of the first Edition.

That offer is limited to 100 pieces.

  • Scubamare has an excellent price performance ratio
  • Materials like 316L steel, ceramic bezel, sapphire crystal and select proven mechanical watch movements
  • Assisted by a mentor from the watch industry

Risks & Challenges

When the campaign goal is reached, the watch goes into production immediately. Minor changes are possible and suggestions from the crowd can still be considered.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

We appreciate any support.

  • Please share this campaign to ensure success.
  • We welcome any support.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Pet Safety via LED Technology

Saving Lives with Increased Night Time Visibility.

Over one million dogs are hit by cars each year in the US, every seven minutes a pedestrian is injured and nearly one-third (32 percent) of all pedestrian fatalities occur between 8:00 p.m. and 11:59 p.m.

We want to help keep you and your furry best friends safe at night with our Premium LED Dog Collars that are visible up to 1,000 feet away in the dark, ensuring that motorists will have ample time to avoid a potentially fatal error.

They also look great and are super comfortable for your buddy to wear!

Our Premium Glow Fetch LED Dog Collars are:

  • Constructed using the highest grade materials, parts and processes.
  • Specially designed to increase visibility at night with reflective nylon webbing and stitching, 6 super bright LED bulbs (large collars have 7) featuring 3 light modes; Steady On, Fast Blink and Slow Blink. 
  • Available in 3 style choices; Sport, Casual and Leather.
  • Available in 3 adjustable sizes; Small, Medium and Large to fit most dogs. (Small is not available for Leather)
  • Fashionable, durable and sure to get your butt sniffed at the dog park!

Choose Your Style, Size and Color!

Glow Fetch collars come in multiple styles, sizes and colors to fit your dog

Casual Collars: Available in black, blue and red.

Sizes: Small: 12.5" - 18"  Medium: 16.5" - 21"   Large: 19" - 24"


Leather Collars: Available in black and brown. 

Sizes: Medium: 16" - 19"    Large: 18" - 23"


Sport Collars: Available in black, blue and red. 

Sizes: Small: 12" - 16"    Medium: 15.5" - 20"   Large: 16.5" - 24"


Quality Craftsmanship

High Quality Materials - Durable buckles, hooks and clasps.

***NOTE: The collar on the left is a generic brand, the right is our premium collar, showing the difference in quality and durability.


Reflective Properties: 

The Sport LED Dog Collars have a center reflective stripe. 

The Casual LED Dog Collars are equipped with reflective stitching.


Interior Padding: 

Both the Leather and Casual LED Dog Collars have high quality padding carefully sewn into the underside of the collar, providing greater comfort for prolonged wear. 


Battery Compartment and Control Housing: 

Designed for ease of use when replacing batteries, simply stack the 2-CR2032 Button Batteries in the battery tray and slide into the control housing.


Pearlized LED Covers: 

The Pearlized LED Covers, equipped on all styles, protect the LED Bulbs while providing an elegant and stylish appearance while both on and off.


Customer Created Product Line...

For the past few years we have had great success selling a generic line of LED Dog Collars and have received tons of barks, wags and even a few hooman suggestions about how we could make our product even better.

Our Customers:

  1. Bought and loved the original Glow Fetch LED Collars.
  2. Made recommendations about how to make the product better.
  3. Helped us narrow down our color options to the most popular choices.
  4. Told us what worked and what didn't as we tested different solutions.
  5. Are now funding the first production run of product!

What We Need:

We have finished the design, have working prototypes and we even have a commitment from a national pet store to carry Glow Fetch after the campaign ends successfully, WOO-HOO! 

We have a premium manufacturer lined up and now we just need YOUR help to make our first run of product. 

Your pledge will:

  • Help us raise the $5k needed to move our prototype to production and make our first run.
  • Help us make sure we have the proper tooling to handle the demand.
  • Give more retailers confidence to stock Glow Fetch on their shelves.
  • Make us really super happy and thrilled. We will love you forever. No. Really. FOREVER!
  • Make you one of the first to own our premium LED dog collars.
  • Help us make a donation to "Deaf Dogs Rock"!

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are not financially able to contribute to our campaign (we completely understand) or you are looking for additional ways to help, please take a look at these great ideas:

  • Share our campaign with your friends, family and coworkers.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share our campaign online.
  • Tell your local pet store or groomer about our campaign.
  • Like us on Facebook, Follow us on Twitter and Instagram to share our campaign there as well!

Additional Perks:

"I Heart My Hooman" - Dog T-Shirts

*This reward is part of the $75 and $95 backer packages. Sizes S-XL.


"Keep Calm and Glow ON" 

Glow In The Dark T-Shirts for Women

*This reward is part of the $75 and $95 backer packages. Sizes S-XL.



"Keep Calm and Glow On"

Glow In The Dark T-Shirts for Men

*This reward is part of the $75 and $95 backer packages. Sizes S-XL.


FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS


How do I choose my style and color?

Once the campaign successful ends, you will receive a BackerKit via email which will allow you to choose your style, color, and any add-ons.


When will my Glow Fetch Collar arrive? 

If all goes well, we are planning to ship Glow Fetch Collars to US backers by the end of July! 

That means you can get them as gifts for the dog lovers in your life to enjoy this summer and beyond!

Will Glow Fetch work if it gets dirty or wet?

The collars are weather-resistant, not waterproof, that means no swimming, bathing or any activity where the collar would become completely submerged. 

The battery housing, switch and light components are sealed pretty tight to prevent damage from light rain, mud, dirt, drool, splashing and licking.

How is this better/different from other light up collars on the market?

Other light up collars on the market are often a novelty item, made from sub-par materials and craftsmanship. Glow Fetch Premium LED Collars are designed as a high-quality, everyday collar first and foremost. The LED lights and components are designed with safety, durability, function and style in mind. While we know we are not the only ones on the market, we do think we provide the best quality and user experience.

How much will Glow Fetch cost in stores?

Retail pricing will be:

  • $30 for Glow Fetch Sport
  • $35 for Glow Fetch Casual
  • $45 for Glow Fetch Leather

When will Glow Fetch be in stores?

We expect to be in most US stores in 2015.

If you want one this year, you will need to back us on Indiegogo :)

What batteries does it take? 

Glow Fetch collars take 2x CR2032 button cells (included in each collar).

How long do the batteries last?

Approximately 20-30 hours of continuous use.

How long is the warranty?

Due to the physical nature of this product, our warranty is limited to manufacturer defects within the first 90 days of receipt.

Do the collars fit dogs of all sizes?

YES!

Fits small dogs like the Shiba Inu shown below all the way up to Great Danes!


Thanks!

Thank you for taking the time out of your day to visit our campaign page and learning about our product and mission.


If you are a member of the media or a retailer and have additional questions, please contact Marisol@GlowFetch.com

story:
THE AVIATOR TRAVEL JACKET IS...

 

1. The only premium travel jacket made in the USA. We use the finest fabric and trims, and cut and sew in our Los Angeles factory. 

2. Backed by a lifetime guarantee. We are not a "fast fashion" brand. Our belief is, If you're investing in our products we are not going to let you down. 

3. Loaded with features for traveling and for everyday use. Each style has features that anyone would want or need for traveling the world or for staying local.

BECAUSE...

- We were truly surprised to learn that there are no "travel" clothing brands making their products in the USA. 

- They say that it would cost too much to make jackets with tons of features in the USA because the American Factories are not set up properly. 

- We want to disrupt the logic behind this theory. We made our samples here and the outcome is top notch. Our factory is fired up for the opportunity to make such a high quality travel jacket. 

- We don't want you to pack another jacket for your next trip. The Aviator Travel Jacket will take you through your journey with function, comfort, and style.



COLORS

SIZE CHART

HANDS-FREE HOODIE IS...


BECAUSE...

- Keeping our phones out of reach and not easily accessible doesn't cut it anymore.

- You can have your tickets and passes ready to be scanned.

- Having too many devices when you only need one, your phone.

- You should look and feel confident that you're ready for what's next.

- Todays world is full of technology, and we want you to stay in control.

- We know America can make premium products at a fair price.

- You're covered by our lifetime guarantee. See below...

Keep your hands free at the airport

Keep your hands free around town.

Protect your device in the rain.


Three way cuff means standard, fingerless, and a mitten. 

COLORS



What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to raise $15,000 so we can keep our factory busy. We just started our first production of this jacket and want to keep it going. 
  • By pledging funds to this project you will be some of the first people to receive this awesome Aviator Travel Jacket and/or  Hands-Free Hoodie at this special pre-order pricing.  
  • The funds will go directly to our domestic suppliers and our Los Angeles factory. 

The Impact


There are so many positives to making our products in the USA. The factory we use in Los Angeles has been in business for 20+ years and is one BIG happy family. It's no secrete why they make premium products for some of todays top brands. For me and the Aviator team, we find it extremely beneficial to have a direct relationship with every contractor who have a hand in making our products. We are in the factory everyday working side by side with the cutters, sewers, and finishers to insure everything is done properly. We know you will appreciate the Aviator difference of making things locally.  

Risks & Challenges

We like to push the envelope with our designs, but not without plenty testing, and research and development. We have been working with our suppliers and factory for many years now. Our relationships with them, and with you, will be completely transparent. We are confident in our ability to deliver a premium product on time. Don't just take it from us, listen to our customers. They have supported us and have expressed their opinions in the comment section on all of our Kickstarter Projects. We couldn't do this without you and we won't let you down!! Thank you!!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our project but can't help by contributing funds right now, please help by sharing. Together we can make traveling a better experience!
