story:
About Paradigm Shirt

Paradigm Shirt is an eco-friendly and ethical clothing brand on a mission to change the second most polluting industry in the world!




We want to empower you! We want to offer you an alternative you can get behind in order to make the world a better place through several principles:



It is costly for the people, for the earth, and it always benefits the same group of very rich people. While we started thinking about how to change this way of life, the idea of creating t-shirts came to us. It is a very democratic and unisex piece of clothing unlike suits.

We wanted to create more than just plain white t-shirts. They had to display amazing  and powerful designs with deeply meaningful messages. They also had to be “beautifully” and ethically made using innovative and sustainable production technologies.

We started thinking that together we could change the world one shirt at a time, and it was already a really great start.

Paradigm Shirt was created in 2017, and is on a mission to change the second most polluting industry.



We selected 9 world-changing non-profits to partner with. Together we found a quote that deeply resonated with their cause. Then we collaborated with super talented designers to illustrate the quote. Each design was made in 3 different versions and we asked you guys to vote for you favorite one!




Did you know that the people who make the clothes sold in fast fashion receive only between 0,5% and 3% of the clothes price? That means when a worker makes a 20€ t-shirt they are paid between 0,1€ and 0,6€, and we are not even talking about children labour. This has to stop.

At Paradigm Shirt we care about the people and the environment that is why our production is 100% ethical and eco-friendly.

Everything is sourced and produced in Japan, from raw material to finished product for a minimized carbon footprint. Japaneses have been mastering the fabric production for centuries and it made sense to appeal to their knowledge to create our textile. It also guarantees us and you humane labor practices for all the happy workers (no psychedelics involved, promise).




To keep bottles out of landfills we recycle and transform them into polyester and use it as fabric for our garments. It limits soil contamination, air, and water pollution.
Polyester from recycled plastic bottles can be indefinitely recycled without no degradation of quality. So it means you can buy a t-shirt that will last a lifetime!

We decided to use an innovative, and sustainable waterless dyeing technique: the Airdye Technology. It is as futuristic as it sounds.

With traditional dyeing method “If a customer needs 300m but the dyeing machine needs 500m to get the right colour, so you are always producing things that are not necessary.” Hani Debs Managing Director and Vice President of Debs Textile Corporation.

The Airdye production system enables production from a few meters without any compromise on quality. It can print and dye with a single pass through AirDye machines. No pre-processes are necessary, eliminating a lot of time and waste in production. By using air instead of water to convey dyes, no hazardous waste is emitted, and no water is wasted.











After working in the entertainment industry for a few years, our CEO, Alexandre Coissard decided to do something that was really aligned with his values and life purpose.

He is from that tribe of social entrepreneurs. For him, businesses should truly benefit the people and the planet, by delivering value sustainably produced, with strong ethics at their core to reduce inequalities and suffering for all living things. His belief is that we should all do our best and be part of the solution to create a better world.


Starting the production
We need your help to start producing the t-shirts in Japan. What we are starting together is so much more than just clothes, it about deciding what world we want to live in. Mass consumption and polluting is too costly for humans and for the environment. Join us on our mission and #BeTheChange

Creating new products
Crowdfunding campaigns are a great way to interact with you guys and see how you perceive our product. Feedback is such valuable information to improve our product. If this campaign is a success it will allow us to start creating new and improved products: denims, shirts, hoodies, jackets, pants, underwear, accessories... so you can be eco-friendly dressed and stylish from head to toe. Who doesn’t want that?

Launching an e-shop
We want our t-shirt to go directly from us to you without any intermediaries. This allows us to offer our eco-friendly t-shirts at the fairest price. That is why we will launch our e-shop with all our products.

Extra
If this campaign is extremely successful, our other goals are to create an awesome self reliant eco-village with an animal sanctuary, and open-source alternative schools. So no worries, no fancy sports cars, designer suits, bling, or big mansions involved.



Why produce in Japan?
We produce our t-shirts in Fukui, Japan. Everything is sourced and made there from raw materials to the finished product for a minimized carbon footprint. Our customers live around the globe so Japan is a perfect central production place. We ship our product directly from Japan to you.

It made sense to produce our garments in this country due to its history with the textile industry. Japanese have been mastering the fabric production for centuries: from manufacturing to dyeing and embroidering. Nowadays they combine their century-old techniques with new scientific technologies to create high-tech textiles.

Being eco-friendly is as important to us as being ethical. Producing our clothes in Japan guarantees us and our customers humane labor practices for all the happy workers. We visited our workshop in Japan so we can guarantee that our suppliers share our values of ethics and ecology.

Why don’t you use organic cotton or hemp?
Cotton is a natural fiber but a very thirsty plant! Textile manufacturers use up to 2,5 trillion gallons of water every year (that’s like, a LOT!). Water is a rare and precious resource, we need to stop taking it for granted. Cotton is not infinitely recyclable like recycled polyester and cannot be dyed with the eco-friendly Airdye technique. Hemp is more sustainable than cotton, but still consumes more resources than recycled plastic bottles, and as it is a natural fiber it cannot use waterless dye either. Traditional dye consumes a lot of water and is very polluting.

What about microparticles released by plastic?

Unfortunately, there is no perfect solution when it comes to textile, but our process according to research is the most sustainable one. Microparticles are very small bits of plastic released when washing clothes for example. They are a real issue because they are filtered and they end up contaminated the oceans and killing fishes because they eat them. About 60% of all clothes are synthetics so everyone is concerned. After doing some research we found 3 simple ways to solve this issue :

The Guppy Friend, the affordable and cutting edge washing bag that catches it all (http://guppyfriend.com/)

Lint LUV-R: On top of removing micro-plastics, it helps to protect your plumbing, and septic system (http://www.environmentalenhancements.com/)

The Cora ball: a cute and simple ball that you just toss into your machine (http://coraball.com/)

Why t-shirts?
It is a very democratic and unisex piece of clothing unlike suits, and it fits everyone :)

When is the rest of the collection coming out?
If (or should I say “When” ;) ) this campaign is a success it will allow us to start creating new and improved products: denims, shirts, hoodies, jackets, pants, underwear, accessories... so you can be eco-friendly dressed from head to toe. Maybe in the next few months if you guys are as excited as we are. We already have plenty of ideas!

How can I choose my design and size for the perks?
Once the campaign ends, you’ll be contacted through email to complete your order survey on BackerKit’s platform, and choose all your options. You will even be able to add last minute additional purchases!

Can I find your products in stores?
No, this your one chance to get your Paradigm Shirt before everyone else! we are currently distributing only through this campaign, and hopefully soon through our own online store.

What if I want to donate my 10% to a different non-profit?
Each t-shirt is made in collaboration with a specific non-profit. We chose a quote that that deeply resonated with their cause, and the design is illustrating it. For now for consistency and logistic reasons it is not possible for you to give your 10% to another non-profit.

When will I receive my order?
Our suppliers are on the edge of their seats waiting for all your pledges! Between all the production process and logistics, we hope to start shipping during December 2017.

What if the t-shirt doesn't fit?
If you carefully pay attention to the size guide this shouldn’t happen. We are producing for orders, so we won’t really hold inventory. In the event of this happening, we will do our best to find a solution with you.

How do you wash the t-shirts?
Like regular t-shirts at 30°C. The Airdye print is really resistant :)

Who are Magic and Woody?  
Officially: our kitties mascots and favorite co-workers
Unofficially: the bosses

Are they vegan friendly?
OF COURSE! They are 100% vegan and 100% Magic and Woody approved.

Which countries do you ship to?
No matter where you are, your order will find you ;). We ship internationally.

Will I pay shipping fees?
Yes, we will charge shipping costs when you will fill out your order survey after the campaign. The average shipping cost will be around 5€. French customers will be charged an extra 20% to account for TVA.
 

REFUND POLICY:
Indiegogo will honor a refund if you do happen to change your mind within 2 days of backing our campaign.
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or returns on items received as Indiegogo perks.
Crowdfunding allows us to build our brand by collecting backer assessments, investing in improvements for our current project, and supply funding to our future designs. Supporting us as a backer, you pledge your support by choosing a perk/reward and is not a retail purchase.  Look at it as a way of supporting a really awesome idea and having the privilege to try a new conceptual product.

For any other question please contact us at: support@paradigmshirt.com


Collective Evolution
A grassroots organization created in 2009, Collective Evolution is now one of the world’s most popular alternative media, production, and community outlets that give readers an opportunity to reshape their everyday way of thinking.

Toronto Cat Rescue
Toronto Cat Rescue is a non-profit, registered charity with all donations going directly to help cats in need.

The Valhalla Movement
Valhalla is on a mission to proliferate Freedom Culture; to empower and encourage all individuals to spread their unique gifts to the world all the while promoting the growth of sustainable communities, the spread of empowering knowledge and the inspiration to take on the world’s biggest challenges via direct action.
 

The ManKind Project
The ManKind Project [MKP] is a global brotherhood of nonprofit organizations that conducts challenging and highly rewarding programs for men at every stage of life.
 

Mr Mondialisation
Mr Mondialisation is an informal citizen French-speaking Think Tank with an international target. Its main objective is to feed the free debate inside the public sphere, around the great world and local issues of our times.

Water.org
Water.org is an international nonprofit organization founded by Gary White and Matt Damon, Water.org pioneers market-driven financial solutions to the global water crisis. For more than 25 years, they’ve been providing families with hope, health and the opportunity to break the cycle of poverty.
 

WeForest
WeForest’s vision is the world where communities and nations sustainably manage forest landscapes and natural resources to address climate change, enhance livelihoods, increase resilience and safeguard biodiversity. They advance innovative, scalable and lasting solutions to restore forest landscapes for climate, people and planet.

Warka Water
Warka Water Inc. is a nonprofit that focuses on innovative and sustainable solutions to some of the humanity’s most enduring problems through the fusion of local knowledge and resources, visionary design and ancient traditions. Warka Water is the creator of the Warka Tower, a vertical structure designed to collect/harvest potable water from the air, giving an alternative water source to the rural population that faces challenges in accessing drinkable water.

PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)
PETA, with more than 6.5 million members and supporters, is the largest animal rights organization in the world. PETA believes that animals have rights and deserve to have their best interests taken into consideration, regardless of whether they are useful to humans.
 

Mercy For Animals
Mercy For Animals believes that a humane society is possible. We are committed to reducing the greatest amount of suffering for the largest number of animals. Our efforts focus on protecting farmed animals, exposing cruelty, prosecuting abusers, and inspiring consumers to make compassionate food choices.
 

L214 Ethique et Animaux
L214 Ethics and Animals, is non-profit association focused on farmed animals (meat, milk, eggs, fishes…), and disclosing farming, transport, fishing and slaughter conditions. The association’s work revolves around 3 complementary axes: raise awareness, offer alternatives and claim the end of animal consumption.
story_txt: About Paradigm ShirtParadigm Shirt is an eco-friendly and ethical clothing brand on a mission to change the second most polluting industry in the world!We want to empower you! We want to offer you an alternative you can get behind in order to make the world a better place through several principles:It is costly for the people, for the earth, and it always benefits the same group of very rich people. While we started thinking about how to change this way of life, the idea of creating t-shirts came to us. It is a very democratic and unisex piece of clothing unlike suits.We wanted to create more than just plain white t-shirts. They had to display amazing  and powerful designs with deeply meaningful messages. They also had to be “beautifully” and ethically made using innovative and sustainable production technologies.We started thinking that together we could change the world one shirt at a time, and it was already a really great start.Paradigm Shirt was created in 2017, and is on a mission to change the second most polluting industry.We selected 9 world-changing non-profits to partner with. Together we found a quote that deeply resonated with their cause. Then we collaborated with super talented designers to illustrate the quote. Each design was made in 3 different versions and we asked you guys to vote for you favorite one!Did you know that the people who make the clothes sold in fast fashion receive only between 0,5% and 3% of the clothes price? That means when a worker makes a 20€ t-shirt they are paid between 0,1€ and 0,6€, and we are not even talking about children labour. This has to stop.At Paradigm Shirt we care about the people and the environment that is why our production is 100% ethical and eco-friendly.Everything is sourced and produced in Japan, from raw material to finished product for a minimized carbon footprint. Japaneses have been mastering the fabric production for centuries and it made sense to appeal to their knowledge to create our textile. It also guarantees us and you humane labor practices for all the happy workers (no psychedelics involved, promise).To keep bottles out of landfills we recycle and transform them into polyester and use it as fabric for our garments. It limits soil contamination, air, and water pollution.Polyester from recycled plastic bottles can be indefinitely recycled without no degradation of quality. So it means you can buy a t-shirt that will last a lifetime!We decided to use an innovative, and sustainable waterless dyeing technique: the Airdye Technology. It is as futuristic as it sounds.With traditional dyeing method “If a customer needs 300m but the dyeing machine needs 500m to get the right colour, so you are always producing things that are not necessary.” Hani Debs Managing Director and Vice President of Debs Textile Corporation.The Airdye production system enables production from a few meters without any compromise on quality. It can print and dye with a single pass through AirDye machines. No pre-processes are necessary, eliminating a lot of time and waste in production. By using air instead of water to convey dyes, no hazardous waste is emitted, and no water is wasted.After working in the entertainment industry for a few years, our CEO, Alexandre Coissard decided to do something that was really aligned with his values and life purpose.He is from that tribe of social entrepreneurs. For him, businesses should truly benefit the people and the planet, by delivering value sustainably produced, with strong ethics at their core to reduce inequalities and suffering for all living things. His belief is that we should all do our best and be part of the solution to create a better world.Starting the productionWe need your help to start producing the t-shirts in Japan. What we are starting together is so much more than just clothes, it about deciding what world we want to live in. Mass consumption and polluting is too costly for humans and for the environment. Join us on our mission and #BeTheChangeCreating new products Crowdfunding campaigns are a great way to interact with you guys and see how you perceive our product. Feedback is such valuable information to improve our product. If this campaign is a success it will allow us to start creating new and improved products: denims, shirts, hoodies, jackets, pants, underwear, accessories... so you can be eco-friendly dressed and stylish from head to toe. Who doesn’t want that?Launching an e-shop We want our t-shirt to go directly from us to you without any intermediaries. This allows us to offer our eco-friendly t-shirts at the fairest price. That is why we will launch our e-shop with all our products.ExtraIf this campaign is extremely successful, our other goals are to create an awesome self reliant eco-village with an animal sanctuary, and open-source alternative schools. So no worries, no fancy sports cars, designer suits, bling, or big mansions involved.Why produce in Japan? We produce our t-shirts in Fukui, Japan. Everything is sourced and made there from raw materials to the finished product for a minimized carbon footprint. Our customers live around the globe so Japan is a perfect central production place. We ship our product directly from Japan to you.It made sense to produce our garments in this country due to its history with the textile industry. Japanese have been mastering the fabric production for centuries: from manufacturing to dyeing and embroidering. Nowadays they combine their century-old techniques with new scientific technologies to create high-tech textiles.Being eco-friendly is as important to us as being ethical. Producing our clothes in Japan guarantees us and our customers humane labor practices for all the happy workers. We visited our workshop in Japan so we can guarantee that our suppliers share our values of ethics and ecology.Why don’t you use organic cotton or hemp? Cotton is a natural fiber but a very thirsty plant! Textile manufacturers use up to 2,5 trillion gallons of water every year (that’s like, a LOT!). Water is a rare and precious resource, we need to stop taking it for granted. Cotton is not infinitely recyclable like recycled polyester and cannot be dyed with the eco-friendly Airdye technique. Hemp is more sustainable than cotton, but still consumes more resources than recycled plastic bottles, and as it is a natural fiber it cannot use waterless dye either. Traditional dye consumes a lot of water and is very polluting.What about microparticles released by plastic?Unfortunately, there is no perfect solution when it comes to textile, but our process according to research is the most sustainable one. Microparticles are very small bits of plastic released when washing clothes for example. They are a real issue because they are filtered and they end up contaminated the oceans and killing fishes because they eat them. About 60% of all clothes are synthetics so everyone is concerned. After doing some research we found 3 simple ways to solve this issue :The Guppy Friend, the affordable and cutting edge washing bag that catches it all (http://guppyfriend.com/)Lint LUV-R: On top of removing micro-plastics, it helps to protect your plumbing, and septic system (http://www.environmentalenhancements.com/)The Cora ball: a cute and simple ball that you just toss into your machine (http://coraball.com/)Why t-shirts?It is a very democratic and unisex piece of clothing unlike suits, and it fits everyone :)When is the rest of the collection coming out?If (or should I say “When” ;) ) this campaign is a success it will allow us to start creating new and improved products: denims, shirts, hoodies, jackets, pants, underwear, accessories... so you can be eco-friendly dressed from head to toe. Maybe in the next few months if you guys are as excited as we are. We already have plenty of ideas!How can I choose my design and size for the perks?Once the campaign ends, you’ll be contacted through email to complete your order survey on BackerKit’s platform, and choose all your options. You will even be able to add last minute additional purchases!Can I find your products in stores?No, this your one chance to get your Paradigm Shirt before everyone else! we are currently distributing only through this campaign, and hopefully soon through our own online store.What if I want to donate my 10% to a different non-profit?Each t-shirt is made in collaboration with a specific non-profit. We chose a quote that that deeply resonated with their cause, and the design is illustrating it. For now for consistency and logistic reasons it is not possible for you to give your 10% to another non-profit.When will I receive my order?Our suppliers are on the edge of their seats waiting for all your pledges! Between all the production process and logistics, we hope to start shipping during December 2017.What if the t-shirt doesn't fit?If you carefully pay attention to the size guide this shouldn’t happen. We are producing for orders, so we won’t really hold inventory. In the event of this happening, we will do our best to find a solution with you.How do you wash the t-shirts?Like regular t-shirts at 30°C. The Airdye print is really resistant :)Who are Magic and Woody?  Officially: our kitties mascots and favorite co-workersUnofficially: the bossesAre they vegan friendly?OF COURSE! They are 100% vegan and 100% Magic and Woody approved.Which countries do you ship to?No matter where you are, your order will find you ;). We ship internationally.Will I pay shipping fees?Yes, we will charge shipping costs when you will fill out your order survey after the campaign. The average shipping cost will be around 5€. French customers will be charged an extra 20% to account for TVA. REFUND POLICY:Indiegogo will honor a refund if you do happen to change your mind within 2 days of backing our campaign.Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or returns on items received as Indiegogo perks.Crowdfunding allows us to build our brand by collecting backer assessments, investing in improvements for our current project, and supply funding to our future designs. Supporting us as a backer, you pledge your support by choosing a perk/reward and is not a retail purchase.  Look at it as a way of supporting a really awesome idea and having the privilege to try a new conceptual product.For any other question please contact us at: support@paradigmshirt.comCollective EvolutionA grassroots organization created in 2009, Collective Evolution is now one of the world’s most popular alternative media, production, and community outlets that give readers an opportunity to reshape their everyday way of thinking.Toronto Cat RescueToronto Cat Rescue is a non-profit, registered charity with all donations going directly to help cats in need.The Valhalla MovementValhalla is on a mission to proliferate Freedom Culture; to empower and encourage all individuals to spread their unique gifts to the world all the while promoting the growth of sustainable communities, the spread of empowering knowledge and the inspiration to take on the world’s biggest challenges via direct action. The ManKind ProjectThe ManKind Project [MKP] is a global brotherhood of nonprofit organizations that conducts challenging and highly rewarding programs for men at every stage of life. Mr MondialisationMr Mondialisation is an informal citizen French-speaking Think Tank with an international target. Its main objective is to feed the free debate inside the public sphere, around the great world and local issues of our times.Water.orgWater.org is an international nonprofit organization founded by Gary White and Matt Damon, Water.org pioneers market-driven financial solutions to the global water crisis. For more than 25 years, they’ve been providing families with hope, health and the opportunity to break the cycle of poverty. WeForestWeForest’s vision is the world where communities and nations sustainably manage forest landscapes and natural resources to address climate change, enhance livelihoods, increase resilience and safeguard biodiversity. They advance innovative, scalable and lasting solutions to restore forest landscapes for climate, people and planet.Warka WaterWarka Water Inc. is a nonprofit that focuses on innovative and sustainable solutions to some of the humanity’s most enduring problems through the fusion of local knowledge and resources, visionary design and ancient traditions. Warka Water is the creator of the Warka Tower, a vertical structure designed to collect/harvest potable water from the air, giving an alternative water source to the rural population that faces challenges in accessing drinkable water.PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)PETA, with more than 6.5 million members and supporters, is the largest animal rights organization in the world. PETA believes that animals have rights and deserve to have their best interests taken into consideration, regardless of whether they are useful to humans. Mercy For AnimalsMercy For Animals believes that a humane society is possible. We are committed to reducing the greatest amount of suffering for the largest number of animals. Our efforts focus on protecting farmed animals, exposing cruelty, prosecuting abusers, and inspiring consumers to make compassionate food choices. L214 Ethique et AnimauxL214 Ethics and Animals, is non-profit association focused on farmed animals (meat, milk, eggs, fishes…), and disclosing farming, transport, fishing and slaughter conditions. The association’s work revolves around 3 complementary axes: raise awareness, offer alternatives and claim the end of animal consumption.

story:
When was the last time you enjoyed the endless charm of twinkling stars and galaxies?



It is sad to realize, but the man who borne and raised in the city seldom seen a starry sky.
But now, you can create your own universe, a little, but at the same time, beautiful and unique!




Our brand has started out in January 2015, and has achieved considerable success already. 
We are represented in several showrooms and now we want to set up shop under our own brand.
We need your help! 


We present you our new jewelry - "my universe"!
Each pendant is handmade of silver 925!


To emphasize your individuality, I have to manually create a pendant to any constellations and stars in the order in which you want it to be truly individual work.



Inside the pendant is an LED that blinks like stars.


The charge lasts for two days of continuous operation, after which it will be necessary to replace the battery. 

Pendant comes with a chain of 925 sterling silver.



Become the first owner of this jewelry!

Inside the pendant is an LED that blinks like stars.

The charge lasts for two days of continuous operation, after which it will be necessary to replace the battery. Pendant comes with a chain of 925 sterling silver.
Become the first owner of this jewelry!

story:
About Kind Socks

Kind Socks is an organic sock wear brand with one aim: to develop fun and beautiful socks in sustainable materials. That means organic cotton that is pure. No pesticides. No toxic chemicals. #stylewithkindness 

But why organic socks? 

Environment, health, education, and charity are the major interests that drive us. Therefore, it was obvious to me to build for the future and start something that could make a difference in the world. I am also inspired by the high awareness that exists in Sweden about the health and environmental damage caused by non-organic products. 

The Designs

We have 9 original designs. All available in Small (EUR 36-40) or Medium size (41-46) and all are available in a mid-calf style. 

The Kickstarter Campaign

This was one of the most exciting months of our lives and the result was totally unexpected. With no marketing budget and no influencers to spread the word, we thought it would be a tough task to reach our modest funding goal. And yet, we hit our goal. We kept thinking the mid-campaign lull was upon us, only to get another surge of backers seemingly from nowhere. Truly this project has changed our lives and we look forward to welcoming backers from Indiegogo to the project. Thank you so much to everyone who chooses to support us! 

About the Team

As a creative person with a lot of ideas on my mind, I knew I would one day start something that will move us one step away from being just an idea I had in my head. After working for several years on digital communications, I decided it was time to stop doing what I was doing at that moment, and start working on fulfilling my creative needs. I talked about making socks several times before, but it always stayed at the idea stage, never really moving any further than that. 

What next for Kind Socks?

Well, this is only the very beginning. Our long-term goal is to work with other ethical brands and artists and collaborate on sock designs. Until then, we have a number of ideas (children sizes) for the next range and hope to become an ethical sock company with a passionate customer base who look forward to seeing what designs we come up with next. 

Kind Socks is ready and waiting to go into production. With your help, we can make our first production run. Please back our project and in return, you'll be among the first and only people in the world to wear these sustainable socks we designed.  

Backing our campaign is super simple:  

Find your reward at the top right of the page. 

Hover over the reward and click 'select this reward'. 

When you are happy with your choice click 'continue to next step'. 

Fill out your payment details - sit back and smile. 

It really is that simple. Please help Kind Socks become a reality by backing the project, and/or telling a friend or sharing us on social media.

story:
Twice As Warm is a clothing company that matches each purchase with a donation of the same clothing to a person in need: 'Wear One, Give One'

 

Twice As Warm in the news:

  • The Washington Post
  • Chicago Tribune
  • The Huffington Post
  • ABC 7 News
  • Start Something That Matters
  • Washington Life Magazine

 

Pre-Order the New Clothing by September 21st:

(You'll select which clothing items you'd like after September 21st)

Earth Marled Beanie. Made from Eco2 Recycled Cotton. Made In USA.

Organic Cotton T-Shirt. Made In USA. Sizes: XSmall - XLarge. Comes in Ocean Blue. Features original Twice As Warm label sewn in bottom left corner.

Toddler/Baby Knit Cap. Made In USA. Available in Light Pink, Light Blue, and Charcoal

Classic 3-Ply Beanie. Made from Eco2 Recycled Cotton. Made In USA. 9 Inches in length. Available in Red.

Fleece Lap Blanket. Made In USA. Length: 40" Width: 38" Available in Light Blue, Light Pink, and Light Yellow

Government Issue Watch Cap. Made from 100% Wool. Meets Department of Defense Specifications.

Watch the quick video on our Gallery page for a first look at the new clothing line. 

More details on the clothing to come...

 

Our 3 Goals for this Winter:

   1. Distribute clothing to people in need in your city, and in cities across the United States.

   2. Launch an invitation-only community website to connect people that want to make a positive impact on their community.

   3. Work directly with American clothing manufacturers to make our clothing right here in the USA, and help bring clothing manufacturing jobs back to the US.

 

Since 2010, we've been giving new clothing to children and families in need in the DC, Maryland, and Virginia  area.

 

This year, we're working directly with American clothing manufacturers to help bring jobs back to the USA.

 

We are on IndieGoGo because we need to raise $8,749 to meet the manufacturer's minimum production requirements.

 

If we don't reach our funding goal by September 21st, we won't receive any of the money, and you'll be 100% refunded.

 

Help us reach the funding goal, and you'll receive the first clothing from our newest clothing line! There's also a number of other perks you can receive --------------------------------------->

 

Here's The Plan:

September 21st, 2012: Reach our funding goal and begin production of our new clothing line with experienced American clothing manufacturers. 

October 26th, 2012: Announce the name of the community website and grant lifetime access to our IndieGoGo supporters. Begin using the website to connect with eachother and coordinate giving events for the winter.

November 22nd, 2012: Finish shipping out the clothing items that were pre-ordered by our IndieGoGo supporters.

November 2012 - February 2013: Organize and launch giving events in communities across the USA with groups of supporters.

 

4 Reasons You Should Back This Project:

  1. Help us distribute new clothing to people in need in your community.

  2. Connect with people and organizations in your community that want to make an impact.

  3. Support the movement to bring clothing manufacturing jobs back the USA.

  4. Check off some of your Holiday Shopping list by September.

  

How IndieGoGo Works

Indiegogo is a crowdfunding platform that helps people raise money to fund their dreams.

My dream is to provide clothing to people in need across the country, and build a community website that will connect people and organizations that want to make the world a better place.

By helping us raise money, you'll receive clothing from our newest clothing line. Check out the 'perks' on the right, and see what you can get as a contributor.

 

6 Ways You Can Help

Here are a few ways that you can help us:

  1. Tell your neighbors about this project, and help us donate over 50 clothing items to people in need in your community.
  2. Start your own group, reach 50 clothing items, and help us organize a giving event in your city.
  3. Email this link to 5 or more of your closest friends/family members.
  4. Share this website link on facebook.
  5. Tweet this link to your friends on Twitter.
  6. Ask about our internship opportunities.

 

 

Frequently Asked Questions

 How do I select which clothing items I want?

After the campaign ends on September 21st, we will contact you to collect information on which clothing items you'd like to order. We'll also collect your shipping address, and collect an email address from you so that you can gain access to the community website.

 What if we don't reach the funding goal by the deadline?

Your money will be 100% refunded and we won't be able to distribute clothing to people in need across the country :(

 How do I start a group?

 Your group members can contribute to this project individually, you don't all have to sign up at once. After the campaign is over, we'll identify who is in which groups, and the groups will be visible on the community website. Start by telling friends/family to visit this page and join us on this journey!

 What if I live outside of the contintal USA?

 We would love your support too! Just please remember to add the additional money required to ship your order internationally. Also, for this project we can only distribute clothing to people in need in the United States.

Where did you get the painting in the the background?

 My mom is an artist and she painted it :)

 

Contact Us

Email me:           brian [at] twiceaswarm [dot] com.

Let's be friends:   facebook.com/twiceaswarm

Let's tweet:         twitter.com/twiceaswarm

 

 Thank you so much for your support!!!

How IndieGoGo Works

Indiegogo is a crowdfunding platform that helps people raise money to fund their dreams. 
My dream is to provide clothing to people in need across the country, and build a community website that will connect people and organizations that want to make the world a better place.
By helping us raise money, you'll receive clothing from our newest clothing line. Check out the 'perks' on the right, and see what you can get as a contributor.

 
6 Ways You Can Help


Here are a few ways that you can help us:

Tell your neighbors about this project, and help us donate over 50 clothing items to people in need in your community.
Start your own group, reach 50 clothing items, and help us organize a giving event in your city.
Email this link to 5 or more of your closest friends/family members.
Share this website link on facebook.
Tweet this link to your friends on Twitter.
Ask about our internship opportunities.


 
 

Frequently Asked Questions
 How do I select which clothing items I want?
After the campaign ends on September 21st, we will contact you to collect information on which clothing items you'd like to order. We'll also collect your shipping address, and collect an email address from you so that you can gain access to the community website.
 What if we don't reach the funding goal by the deadline?
Your money will be 100% refunded and we won't be able to distribute clothing to people in need across the country :(
 How do I start a group?
 Your group members can contribute to this project individually, you don't all have to sign up at once. After the campaign is over, we'll identify who is in which groups, and the groups will be visible on the community website. Start by telling friends/family to visit this page and join us on this journey!
 What if I live outside of the contintal USA?
 We would love your support too! Just please remember to add the additional money required to ship your order internationally. Also, for this project we can only distribute clothing to people in need in the United States.
Where did you get the painting in the the background?
 My mom is an artist and she painted it :)
 


Contact Us
Email me:           brian [at] twiceaswarm [dot] com.
Let's be friends:   facebook.com/twiceaswarm
Let's tweet:         twitter.com/twiceaswarm
 
 Thank you so much for your support!!!

story:
This all began 4 years ago on a summer afternoon. The sun & BBQ grill were hot, but so were our sodas and beers.  All this heat sparked an idea...and our dream to bring you The Kool-Z was born. Fast forward to today, and after tons of detailed planning, consultation with experts in the fields of design & manufacturing, and numerous prototypes...we are so excited to bring to you The Kool-Z!  

The Kool-Z Is A New Way to Drink From A Can. Our goal is for YOU to get maximum enjoyment from your beverage. The Kool-Z has been designed to lock in your drinks icy temperature, keeping it colder, longer. The Kool-Z is double-wall insulated, completely enclosing any standard 12oz can like a wet suit - snugly.

 

We’ve Taken Care To Look At Every Detail Meticulously. The Kool-Z is designed to be sleek yet rugged, with a clear outer skin and a black lid that seals your beverage shut. We’ve also made sure that your beverage “drinks” smoothly. Drinking from the Kool-Z is an awesome experience – the liquid flows effortlessly and the spout is designed for chugging!

 

The Kool-Z Is Different. The Kool-Z is like a regular can "koozie"... on steroids. Those old koozies are so 1996. They are flimsy and cheap and never really got the job done. We have done our best to design the Kool-Z to be fresh and functional.

 

1. You Drink Directly From The Kool-Z…Not From A Dirty, Dusty Can. Beverage factories, shipping crates and store shelves aren’t exactly sanitary. The Kool-Z makes it so you’ll never have to touch your lips to dusty cans again.  Can rims are dirty - they accumulate debris, and germs.  Sometimes you can even taste the dust.  We think that’s just gross. And by the way, the Kool-Z is 100% BPA Free so it's safe to use.

2. The Kool-Z Has A Swivel Top, Enabling You To Fully Seal Off Your Drink. We hate when you're outside and insects of the world use your beverage as a bath tub.  Or when you're at the beach and sand gets in your soda.  The Kool-Z has a swivel – your beverage stays closed off to the outside – until you open it.

 

Did We Mention...The Kool-Z Is Incredibly Easy To Use? Just crack open a can, drop it in the Kool-Z and snap the Kool-Z lid back on.  Rinse and repeat.

The underside of the lid (and whole body) is molded to fit the top grooves of soda and beer cans. 

 

 
Choose Any Color: Silver, Green, Red, Pink, Blue, Black - Or White (Not Shown)

 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

Why do you need funding?  What will you do with the money?  The funding will be for tooling/manufacturing cost. We've worked hard to get the Kool-Z from concept to (almost) reality.  We have our manufacturer all lined up, designs in place, prototype approved and timeline set. 

All we need is the final push funding.

Tell me a bit more about the "Customizable Kool-Z"?  We'll customize the look of your Kool-Z any way you want. This means that at the end of project, we'll provide you with a way to upload a picture file (e.g. .JPEG, .PNG, .JIF, etc) - and we will send you your Kool-Zs with your picture screen printed on the Kool-Z.  Here's an example.

Note that we respect all copyright laws and cannot accept obscene or otherwise inappropriate materials.

Can you pour a drink into the Kool-Z and drink without a can?  Absolutely!   

Do you have larger pics of the Tee Shirts and Cooler? 

 

Is the campaign the first opportunity for anyone to own a Kool-Z?  Yes! Pledge to our campaign and be the first to own a Kool-Z.   

What if I am interested in Wholesale orders other than the perks listed?

If you are interested in Wholesale please contact us, contact@thekoolz.com

Do you have plans for additional Kool-Z product lines down the road?  Yes, and we can’t wait to bring them to you. If this project is successful, we plan to offer more products. To get a sense of what we have in mind, below are pictures of different types of Kool-Zs that we would be excited to bring to you...in the near future:

Different Color Lids
A Different Spout

Please support our product and click on the button and try a Kool-Z for yourself.  

Thanks, you are really great.

Sincerely,

Ryan, PJ & Austin

The Kool-Z is a registered trademark of The Kool-Z, LLC. All designs are patent protected by one or more USA and foreign patents and/or patents pending.
